channel.title: Guides on ActiveState Platform Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Guides on ActiveState Platform Documentation

item.title: Getting Started Guide
item.description: You can use the ActiveState Platform API to define repeatable, composable, serverless builds. Tutorial Step-by step instruction on how to start a project. The tutorial is written for developers without GraphQL experience. The tutorial covers: Authentication Connecting to the GraphQL endpoint Your first query Understanding mutations Exploring the capabilities of the API Quick Start A one page summary of how to start a new project. Where do I go next?

item.title: Contents - Outline TOC
item.description: GraphQL & ActiveState Platform “GraphQL allows you to declaratively express your data needs…queries are the representation of the data you need.” “Notice how the query signature exactly matches the returned JSON signature. This is possible because in GraphQL, you query against a schema that is the representation of your available data.” “GraphiQL is a UI that lets you 1) run queries against your data in the browser, and 2) dig into the structure of data available to you through a data type explorer.

item.title: Builder Fundamentals Guide
item.description: What is the ActiveState Platform Builder? ActiveState Platform architecture diagram Package Database (aka Ingredients) Dependancy Resolver (aka Head Chef) Build Wrapper Design methodology Structure Example Supported build images Reference: Image Strawman CircleCI provides quite detailed inforamtion about the configurations they support that your build will run on. Executors and Images Pre-Build CircleCI Docker Images Artifacts References: Artifact Cache Key Components Artifacts Requirements Gathering Best Practices Troubleshooting
